summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York informing recipients about a recent order from Judge Nathan regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1. The rule applies to counsel of record and associated attorneys, such as attorneys for witnesses, in a criminal case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued a recent order regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1 in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sent this email to inform recipients about Judge Nathan's order regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1.

events.title: Order Regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1, which applies to counsel of record and associated attorneys in a criminal case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Judge Nathan issued an order regarding Local Criminal Rule 23.1 on or about July 30, 2021.
Local Criminal Rule 23.1 applies not only to counsel of record but also to attorneys associated with a case, such as attorneys for witnesses.
The communication is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Epstein-related case.
